title: Biden signs law declassifying US intel on Covid origin
description: The White House is trying to appease Congress, which wants to pursue the 'lab theory' further, while holding back from further antagonizing Beijing.

title: The IPCC summary for policymakers of climate change 2023: Synthesis report
description: The text approved by the 195 member countries of the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change calls for a leap of faith to keep the hope of limiting global warming to 1.5°C.

title: Bezalel Smotrich, Israeli ultra-nationalist minister, delivers anti-Palestinian diatribe in Paris
description: Benyamin Netanyahu's finance minister participated in a gala event in Paris at the invitation of a French Jewish association close to the far right, during which he said that 'the Palestinian people [was] an invention.'

title: Macron survives no-confidence vote over French pension reform
description: French MPs reject motion of no-confidence in Macron's government with just nine crucial votes preventing the vote from passing.

title: In the wake of ChatGPT, the race for artificial intelligence is on
description: As OpenAI, a Microsoft partner, launches its GPT-4, Google, Meta and the Chinese company Baidu are speeding up the release of software and tools capable of generating texts

title: Jordanian pilot burned alive by IS in 2015: The story of a failed release
description: Commissioned by Amman, a former Jordanian colonel recounts his journey and negotiations with the jihadist group for the release of a fighter pilot captured in Syria in 2014.

title: Northern Ireland unionists confirm they will say no to Sunak's Brexit deal
description: The Democratic Unionist Party said they would vote against UK Government on 'Stormont brake.'

title: French government faces no-confidence vote after its decision to bypass Parliament on pension reform
description: Debates on two motions of no-confidence have started on Monday afternoon in the Assemblée Nationale. Votes are expected to take place in the early evening.

title: French police getting 'rougher' as spontaneous protests grow
description: Critics are raising the alarm about violent confrontations and the systematic use of arrests at rallies against the government's use of a controversial constitutional tool.

title: Banks' fear of contagion persists in Europe
description: The rescue of Credit Suisse is not enough to calm investors' anxieties and central banks are mobilizing to provide liquidity to the markets.

title: French journalist, US aid worker kidnapped in Sahel are freed
description: Olivier Dubois, 48, had been kidnapped in Mali in 2021 while Jeffery Woodke went missing in Niger in 2016.

title: Putin welcomes Chinese leader Xi to Kremlin
description: The visit sends a powerful message to Western leaders allied with Ukraine that their efforts to isolate Moscow have fallen short and showed off Beijing's new diplomatic swagger.

title: Who is still dying of Covid-19 in France?
description: Three years after the first lockdown, the pandemic has come to a lull, even as the disease continues to kill about 20 people a day.

title: IPCC's synthesis report is a 'practical guide to defusing the climate time bomb', says Guterres
description: The Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change, which published on Monday its summary of eight years of work, maintains the tenuous hope that there is still a chance to limit warming to 1.5 °C, provided that a dedicated international effort is made.

title: With ICC warrant, Putin has officially become a political pariah
description: The arrest warrant issued by the International Criminal Court for the Russian president on Friday increases his isolation and sends a much-needed signal of justice to Ukraine.

title: French pension reform: No-confidence motion strives for broad support in Assemblée Nationale
description: Introduced in reaction to the forced passage of the pension reform, the proposal that could lead to the dissolution of the government must be backed by at least 28 right-wing MPs.

title: 'IPCC have last word on report as long as they don't challenge the interests of major powers'
description: Researcher Kari De Pryck says the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change has become a key player in the fight against climate change, but scientists are under strong pressure from governments.

title: 'Good old friend': Putin commends Xi ahead of Moscow visit
description: Isolated by the West and pushed around militarily by Kyiv, the Russian president is counting more than ever on his Chinese 'friend.'

title: EU agrees to fast-track military support to Ukraine
description: On Monday, defense ministers are expected to approve a two billion euro plan to send one million shells and missiles to Ukraine within twelve months.

title: Thai PM dissolves parliament and calls for election
description: Prayut Chan-ocha, a former coup leader, seeks to extend army-backed rule in the Southeast Asian country.

title: Tear gas, arrests as Kenya opposition stages protests
description: Residents in Kenya are protesting as they suffer from surging prices for basic necessities and a sharp drop in the local shilling against the US dollar.

title: Global stocks sink after Credit Suisse takeover
description: Investors worry banks are cracking under the strain of unexpectedly fast, large rate hikes over the past year to cool economic activity and inflation.

title: How an employee of Lafarge's Syria cement factory gathered intelligence on IS
description: Ahmad Jaludi, the former security chief at the factory in Syria, is under investigation for financing terrorism and complicity in crimes against humanity. He speaks for the first time about his role in support of the Western coalition against the Islamic State organization (IS).

title: 'Iran-Saudi Arabia normalization sealed in Beijing is a major turning point in the recomposition of the Middle East'
description: By sponsoring normalization between Iran and Saudi Arabia, China is anchoring its role as a global power in the Middle East.

title: French distrust of politics back on the rise after Covid hiatus
description: In a country torn apart by a controversial pension reform, confidence levels in state institutions are at their lowest since the Yellow Vests crisis, according to a new survey.

title: Mali: Two Red Cross employees kidnapped in early March were released
description: Mali has been gripped by a security and political crisis since 2012 when jihadist and separatist insurgencies broke out in the country's north. The ICRC has been in Mali for over three decades.

title: Kim Jong Un 'satisfied' with 'nuclear conterattack' simulation
description: North Korean military drills over the weekend were the fourth show of force from Pyongyang in a week and came during Freedom Shield, the biggest US-South Korea military exercise in five years.

title: In Peru, the villagers of Machu Picchu feel abandoned
description: The inhabitants of the Inca site region have been demanding better income redistribution from local tourism to benefit the development of local infrastructure.

title: Loulouwa Al-Rachid: 'The 2003 invasion of Iraq is one of those wars from which no one wins'
description: Twenty years after the United States invaded Iraq, the researcher discusses the upheavals that this war has caused in Iraqi society and in the region.

title: Japan's evolving security strategy in the face of China's rising power
description: Tokyo is actively participating in the redeployment of the United States and its allies' forces, along the chain of large archipelagos that stretch in an arc in front of China, from Hokkaido to the Philippines, via Taiwan.

title: Research shows bees' dance is not instinctive but learned behavior
description: Researchers recently proved that the famous waggle dance used by explorer bees to indicate to their fellow explorers a source of food is not an innate behavior but one that is in part socially acquired.

title: Paris Saint-German lose at home against Rennes
description: The result means Marseille cut PSG's lead at the top of the table to seven points after defeating Reims.

title: 'By ignoring the Ukrainian identity of the painters, the Musée d'Orsay is made into an instrument of Russian propaganda'
description: There are numerous examples of French museums that have participated in the propagation of Russian imperialist narratives through art, according to the academic Olena Havrylchyk, who calls for 'the decolonization of Ukrainian art.'
